article_title: Deutsche Bahn Halts Stuttgart 21 Project, Handelsblatt Reports
article_text: SHARE THIS ARTICLE   Share   Tweet   Post   Email  {"contentId":"LIUU461A74E901","position":"brokerboxarticle","dimensions":{"large_desktop":[[120,60]],"small_desktop":[[120,60]],"tablet":[[120,60]]},"strategy":"viewable","positionIncrement":1,"targeting":{"position":"brokerboxarticle1","url":"/news/articles/2011-03-30/deutsche-bahn-halts-stuttgart-21-project-handelsblatt-reports"},"containerId":"brokerboxarticle-tQyUF6j"}   Deutsche Bahn AG has halted the Stuttgart 21 rail project in Baden-Wuerttemberg after the Greens and the Social Democratic Party, which both oppose the development, formed a coalition in the state, Handelsblatt said.    The railway company also decided not to grant any building contracts for the project for the moment, the newspaper said, citing Deutsche Bahn. The company will try to start talks with the new state government in May, Handelsblatt said.    Baden-Wuerttemberg may face damage claims if the new state government cancels the Stuttgart 21 project, Handelsblatt reported, citing German Transport Minister Peter Ramsauer.     Published on ‎30‎ ‎March‎, ‎2011‎ ‎07‎:‎12        Have a confidential tip for our reporters? GET IN TOUCH    Before it's here, it's on the Bloomberg Terminal.
